title.narrative: COMMUNITY-BASED PARENTING & Early Child Development (ECD) SERVICES

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, national and local authorities provide quality, inclusive community-based parenting and Early Child Development (ECD) support services to the most disadvantaged boys and girls and their families., which contributes to Early Childhood Development, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Early Child Development (ECD) services for vulnerable children ensure that girls and boys from the poorest families, including those with disabilities or developmental risks, and from the Roma minority benefit from Â i) inclusive, community-based preschool services for children and families ii) family based early childhood intervention programmes and services and iii) perinatal care services and better parenting education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, national and local authorities provide quality, inclusive community-based parenting and ECD support services tothe most disadvantaged boys and girls and their families.

description.narrative: Increased access to quality and inclusive community-based parenting and YCD support services on national and (selected) county level, with emphasis on the most vulnerable children and families, through the CO technical support in capacity building and strengthening networks of local service providers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2017

title.narrative: of service providers implementing quality, inclusive community-based YCD support services and parenting services in selected counties.

baseline.value: 18 service providers in 3 selected counties (SMC, SKC, VSC, in 2011

actual.value: 2016:OVERACHIEVED54 service providers in 3 selected counties which represents 200 % increase in the total number of service providers of inclusive, community based parenting and YCD support services,(those providing services initiated/supported by UNICEF in partnership with relevant ministries, local g

title.narrative: Existence and systemic implementation of quality and sustainable support programme(s) for parents of young children with disabilities

target.value: 2016:Quality programme(s) of support for parents of young children with disabilities established, nationally available and sustainable

actual.value: 2016:COMPLETED The new model of parenting support programme for parents of children with disabilities, which was developed and promoted in 2014, is available in 29 cities/towns all over Croatia. The Education and Teacher Training Agency (ETTA) provides training of professionals for implementation of th

title.narrative: Nationally available and easily accessible expert support services (e.g. phone and/or on-line services) for parents of young children

target.value: 2016:Expert parenting support services are available, accessible and of high quality

actual.value: 2016:COMPLETED The phone and on-line counselling service for parents and other care-takers of the youngest children is nationally available and fully funded.

title.narrative: Existence of a policy for pre-primary and preschool coverage expansion
